availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew M. McCord (Madison County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Madison County native. Son of David McCord and Elvira McCord. Farmer in Madison County in 1850. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Resident in Madison County in 1860. Household owned twenty enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as sergeant from September 10, 1862. Captured at Buffington Island, Ohio on July 19, 1863. Prisoner of war at Camp Morton in Indianapolis, Indiana, from July 23, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 3, p. 295B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 3, p. 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 447.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 60.
